intro: Notelaea azorica, commonly known as the Azorean notelaea, is a rare endemic plant native to the Azores. It is a shrub-like species characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are thick and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Notelaea azorica plays an important role in the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
